summary: The documents reference sworn statements in the context of investigations and information gathering. Victor Lee Trinkala provided a sworn statement on February 19, 1970, regarding his discharge from the Army and his limited contact with Richard Nagell. This statement was taken by the 108th MI Group. Another document mentions Henry D. Glaister authorizing the release of an agent report concerning Joseph Timothy White to Norval White Jr. in a sworn statement dated October 3, 1982. The sworn statements appear to be used as official records of testimony or authorization within investigative or administrative processes.
significance: Sworn statements are significant as they represent formal records of testimony or authorization, potentially providing crucial information or evidence in investigations related to the JFK assassination or related matters. The content of these statements can shed light on individuals, events, and connections relevant to the broader context of the assassination and its aftermath.
